descriptionMarkdown:
Have you ever wanted to just hold onto a signal for a little while? This design expands on the [multivalue thread safe memory-latch](https://www.factorio.school/view/-NKdX6xPrxFsZ9Eu_vO-) published by [Denis Kudelin](https://www.factorio.school/user/kjFeZufGe5PT2m07tSKNWYsLzEI2) and adds two variants, one in a partially-finished state to better integrate with your designs and one as a complete package to control a power switch.

## 10s Multi-Value Memory Blueprint

Run a red wire into the constant combinator on the right labeled `INPUT` with whatever your rapidly-changing values are. When they change, the light will turn red. Every ten seconds, the system will update the value of the green wire coming from the constant combinator labeled `OUTPUT` with a snapshot of the values coming in from the input side. This provides [hysteresis functionality](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hysteresis) to your designs with little extra effort.

If you want to adjust the timer, find the decider combinator by the substation that lists `A < 600`. Modify it to whatever your new value should be (number of seconds * 60). Then adjust the decider combinator near it (the only decider combinator that outputs the `information` signal) to be `your number - 20`. For example, to set it to five seconds instead of ten, your first value would be `300` and the second value would be `280`.

## Automatic Power Switch Blueprint

Have you ever wanted to turn off part of your factory when the power supply gets too low, then watched in horror as the power switch flickered 30 times a second while your available power sits at the same value? Have I got the solution for you! The above blueprint has been slightly rearranged and assembled into a 10 second delay on the current availability of the power grid. Below 70%, the switch turns off and waits 10 seconds before checking again, and above 70%, the switch enables. Adjust this value on the switch itself and if you want to adjust the timer, follow the instructions above.

## Manually Resetting the Latch

There is a constant combinator, turned off, that outputs the `information` signal. If you need to manually reset the latch, toggle that combinator on and off and the light should turn off to indicate that the latch has been reset.
title: 10s Buffering Multi-Value Memory Cell + Power Switch
